title: The Temple Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About The Temple
description: Test your knowledge of the 21 biblical commandments related to the temple. Covers 9 positive and 12 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment requires building a sanctuary so that G-d may dwell among the people?
questions.explanation: Commandment #301 instructs to build a sanctuary so that G-d may dwell among them, as found in Exodus 25:8.

questions.question: According to the commandments, which of the following is forbidden when constructing an altar?
options: Building the altar outside the Temple
questions.explanation: Commandment #302 prohibits building the altar with stones hewn by metal to avoid profaning it (Exodus 20:25).

questions.question: What is the negative commandment about planting trees in the Temple courtyard?
options: Do not plant a tree in the Temple courtyard
Do not plant any flowers in the Temple courtyard
Do not plant vines in the Temple courtyard
Do not plant shrubs in the Temple courtyard
questions.correctAnswer: Do not plant a tree in the Temple courtyard
questions.explanation: Commandment #52 forbids planting a tree in the Temple courtyard, as stated in Deuteronomy 16:21.

questions.question: Which commandment requires keeping the fire burning on the altar continuously?
options: Keep the fire burning on the altar
Do not extinguish the fire on the altar
questions.correctAnswer: Keep the fire burning on the altar
questions.explanation: Commandment #374 mandates the fire on the altar shall remain burning all night, as in Leviticus 6:9.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids climbing steps to the altar to avoid exposing nakedness?
options: Do not climb steps to the altar
Do not enter the altar area barefoot
Do not touch the altar with hands
Do not build the altar with wood
questions.correctAnswer: Do not climb steps to the altar
questions.explanation: Commandment #303 forbids climbing steps to the altar so nakedness will not be exposed (Exodus 20:26).

questions.question: Which positive commandment involves preparing a holy anointing oil?
options: Make the show bread and place it before G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #307 instructs to prepare the holy anointing oil for sacred use (Exodus 30:31).

questions.question: What does commandment #401 require from someone who profanes a sacred object?
options: Repay the item plus a fifth and bring a sacrifice
Destroy the object and bring a sacrifice
Wash their hands in the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: Repay the item plus a fifth and bring a sacrifice
questions.explanation: Commandment #401 requires restitution with an additional fifth plus a sacrifice for profaning sacred objects (Leviticus 5:16).

questions.question: Which of the following is forbidden regarding the anointing oil?
options: Do not reproduce the anointing oil
Do not use it on priests
Do not burn it on the altar
Do not prepare it in the Tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: Do not reproduce the anointing oil
questions.explanation: Commandment #308 prohibits reproducing the anointing oil in the same proportions, as it is holy (Exodus 30:32).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids anointing a foreigner with the holy anointing oil?
options: Do not anoint a foreigner with anointing oil
Do not anoint the High Priest
questions.correctAnswer: Do not anoint a foreigner with anointing oil
questions.explanation: Commandment #309 forbids anointing a foreigner with the holy anointing oil (Exodus 30:32).

questions.question: Which item must have its poles remain fixed and not be removed, according to the commandments?
questions.explanation: Commandment #313 forbids removing the staves from the Ark (Exodus 25:15).

questions.question: Which commandment requires burning incense every morning during Temple service?
options: Keep the fire burning on the altar
questions.explanation: Commandment #377 instructs Aaron to burn fragrant incense every morning (Exodus 30:7).

questions.question: What is forbidden to be burned on the Golden Altar besides incense?
questions.explanation: Commandment #311 forbids offering anything other than incense on the Golden Altar (Exodus 30:9).

questions.question: Which commandment mandates lighting the Menorah every day from evening to morning?
options: Keep the fire burning on the altar
questions.explanation: Commandment #378 requires Aaron and his sons to keep the Menorah lit from evening to morning (Exodus 27:21).

questions.question: Which positive commandment instructs making the showbread and placing it before G-d at all times?
options: Make the show bread and place it before G-d
questions.correctAnswer: Make the show bread and place it before G-d
questions.explanation: Commandment #381 mandates setting the bread of the Presence on the table before G-d at all times (Exodus 25:30).

questions.question: Which commandment requires guarding the Temple area to prevent desecration?
options: Do not leave the Temple unguarded
questions.explanation: Commandment #305 instructs guarding the Temple and serving within it (Numbers 18:2).

questions.question: Which negative commandment prohibits leaving the Temple unguarded?
options: Do not leave the Temple unguarded
Do not climb steps to the altar
Do not plant a tree in the Temple courtyard
Do not remove the staves from the ark
questions.correctAnswer: Do not leave the Temple unguarded
questions.explanation: Commandment #306 forbids leaving the Temple unprotected to avoid divine wrath (Numbers 18:5).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment to not reproduce the incense formula is found in Exodus 30:37.
questions.explanation: Commandment #310 prohibits making the incense in the same proportions for personal use (Exodus 30:37).

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #320 allows loosening the breastplate from the ephod.
questions.explanation: Commandment #320 forbids loosening the breastplate from the ephod to maintain its sacred integrity (Exodus 28:28).

questions.question: True or False: Showing reverence to the Temple is a positive commandment found in Leviticus 19:30.
questions.explanation: Commandment #304 instructs revering the sanctuary and keeping the Sabbaths (Leviticus 19:30).

questions.question: True or False: The commandment 'Do not destroy objects associated with G-d's Name' is a positive commandment.
questions.explanation: Commandment #8 is a negative commandment forbidding destruction of objects associated with G-d's Name (Deuteronomy 12:4).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The commandment to keep the fire burning on the altar is found in ________.
questions.explanation: Commandment #374 mandates keeping the altar fire burning at all times (Leviticus 6:9).
